item.title: Bridge returned error 400! (18711)

item.title: The city continues to SWEEP encampments AGAINST CDC guidelines...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

The city continues to SWEEP encampments AGAINST CDC guidelines during a PANDEMIC! They have not learned that sweeping people does not work! DOTI has planned 3 SWEEPS THIS WEEK on Tuesday 3/23 at 500 Quivas, on Wednesday 3/24 in the ballpark neighborhood at 22nd and wazee from Blake to Larimer and Thursday 3/25 at 26th and Tremont and 30th. The SWEEPS will begin each day at 6:30 a.m.
Please come and support our unhoused community members as they demand real housing or places ...where they are allowed to survive.
Bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing‚Ä¶

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=10224739034400742&id=1158510651&sfnsn=mo

Jess Wiederholt is with Vincent Chandler and 22 others.

Join us for:

üë©üèª‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë©üèæ MONDAY NIGHT MUTUAL AIDüë®üèº‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüë®üèæ

MARCH 22nd, 4-7pm ...
14TH AND BANNOCK ST

Education Topic:
RIGHTS OF THE UNHOUSED

Guest speaker: Ana Sofia Cornelius from Denver Homeless Out Loud will explain rights of our houseless neighbors including information on:

üëâ Court injunction against the City of Denver.

üëâ What is a "sweep"?

üëâ Difference between the types of notices; incumbrance, camping ban, private property.

üëâ Which notices are and aren‚Äôt legal.

‚úäüèΩThis training is to empower unhoused with the information they need to stand up to harassment.

‚úäüèΩAlso, this training is for mutual aid workers so that we can better assist our neighbors.

Training starts at 5 pm. It will also be live streamed. Stay and serve food, pass out supplies, make heating sources, and get to know your neighbors experiencing homelessness. ‚ô•Ô∏è

Donations of food, clothing, shoes, blankets, tents, snacks & drinks always needed!

THIS INHUMANE HARASSMENT MUST END!!

item.title: Homelessness and growing unsanctioned camps were on the rise ...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Homelessness and growing unsanctioned camps were on the rise before the pandemic hit. This is a much better option than the randomness of unsanctioned camps. We need about 50 camps like this to meet the need since mid summer. The need only grows.

Don't be fooled the need will continue o grow post pandemic, much in the same way it was already growing before the pandemic. Until we make housing affordable to people working minimum wage jobs, the numbers of folks on the street will continue to grow. Is it so hared to line up a few tents
with some rules of conduct trash and bathroom service. That alone will meet 90% of the need.

Colorado Village Collaborative

Safe Outdoor Spaces are working in Denver.
Got land in a neighborhood ready to work towards solutions?
We need you to help us create the next one.
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: The SWEEP this morning is being conducted by DPD district 6, not...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

The SWEEP this morning is being conducted by DPD district 6, not the HOT team. They are over the top aggressive. Officer Mendez stated "You dont want me to take my badge off" to a volunteer (yes we have it recorded). There are several handicapped folks being denied assistance.
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: I have been instructed that if you are concerned with the sweeps...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

I have been instructed that if you are concerned with the sweeps you can contact the Mayors office representative Evan Dryer at this number. He is at the sweep as we speak. 720.350.8370

Ask him about the 100% reimbursement from FEMA to house these folks and don't let him get it confused with the Covid money which is separate and focused on folks who are sick or at great risk of getting sick.

https://www.whitehouse.gov/‚Ä¶/extend-federal-support-to-go‚Ä¶/‚Ä¶(DHRC-Update-2.3.2021
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: There is still a foot of snow on the ground! Our cities cruelty...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

There is still a foot of snow on the ground! Our cities cruelty to our most vulnerable is telling. The Covid money is specific for those at risk of Covid. But there is also FEMA money available. The federal Gov't will pay to place these folks in hotels with100% reimbursement. There is no excuse for this. Care to explain Hancock?

Hancock say publically it is inhumane for people to be living on the sidewalk, yet when in a position to do something humane for a change he would rather sweep them than house them.
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: TheCity of Denver is closed today because of ramifications of...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

TheCity of Denver is closed today because of ramifications of the storm.Being so compassionate to folks who would have to travel through theaftermath. Do not expect the same compassion for our homeless whentomorrow's scheduled sweep comes to pass.

1.Trash truck pretty much says the intent of the contractor the cityhired. EMS is very expensive for what they do.

2.Support vehicle

...

3.This is where they place belongings that do not get trashed. They arepoorly labeled or identified in any useful way that anyone canreconnect with their belongings without multiple tries (and failures for EMS to find their belongings) before eventually finding some oftheir belongings after several failures. Most folks don't try becauseword gets around of how much of a waste of time it is. REMEMBER theseguys are very expensive for what they do.

4 Supervisor truck

No one gets housed as a result of these things... just relocated. Any thought to where they might relocate too? There is a foot of snow on top of everything all around the city. The Mayor's office is not driven by compassion. They are driven by a desire to push our most vulnerable out of sight of the most powerfull who apear to be upset being reminded of where thier riches came from in the first place. How about plowing that parking lot in the picture that is usually mostly empty and allowing folks to set up there. It would be a far cry better than folks wrapped around said parking lot along the sidewalks.

This will make the 8th time the area has been swept in the last year.

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: "In a desperate answer to a dire problem, San Francisco is...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"In a desperate answer to a dire problem, San Francisco is setting up sanctioned homeless encampments throughout the city ‚Äî becoming the first in the region to embrace a dramatic policy shift that would have seemed far-fetched just a few months ago.

After watching the number of tents within its borders increase by 71% during the coronavirus pandemic, San Francisco opened its first temporary, city-organized encampment this month ‚Äî a fenced-off piece of asphalt with dozens of t...ents right outside City Hall. Two others are set to open within days, with more likely to come.

It‚Äôs a controversial strategy that‚Äôs sparked pushback from neighbors worried about safety, and from activists who argue the camps are neither humane nor sufficient for the scope of the problem. But proponents, including Mayor London Breed, say they‚Äôre the best option available. And while other major Bay Area cities mostly have avoided adopting city-organized encampments for years ‚Äî despite their expanding homeless populations ‚Äî some outreach workers say it‚Äôs time to embrace the inevitable."

https://www.mercurynews.com/‚Ä¶/amid-coronavirus-are-sanctio‚Ä¶/

See MoreSan Francisco is opening city-organized homeless camps ‚Äî a big shift for a city that, pre-pandemic, prioritized eliminating tent cities.

mercurynews.com

Amid coronavirus, are sanctioned tent cities the answer to Bay Area homelessness?

San Francisco is opening city-organized homeless camps ‚Äî a big shift for a city that, pre-pandemic, prioritized eliminating tent cities.San Francisco is opening city-organized homeless camps ‚Äî a big shift for a city that, pre-pandemic, prioritized eliminating tent cities.

item.title: "The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention recommends that officials not disturb tent encampments during the coronavirus pandemic unless people are given individual hotel rooms, as homeless advocates want to see. Those advocates say providing a safe space where people can get meals, use a toilet and avoid harassing passers-by is a reasonable option given the times.

‚ÄúThe best, best option would be housing. The second-best option would be hotel rooms, but if you can‚Äôt do that and we‚Äôre going to have so many people outside then I think it makes sense ... to make those outside as safe as can be,‚Äù said Dr. Margot Kushel, director of the Center for Vulnerable Populations at the University of California, San Francisco."

https://www.usnews.com/‚Ä¶/san-francisco-sanctions-once-shunn‚Ä¶"

A city-sanctioned homeless encampment with 80 tents has sprung up by San Francisco's City Hall, part of an effort to protect the homeless amid the coronavirus pandemic.

usnews.com

San Francisco Sanctions Once-Shunned Homeless Encampments

A city-sanctioned homeless encampment with 80 tents has sprung up by San Francisco's City Hall, part of an effort to protect the homeless amid the coronavirus pandemic.A city-sanctioned homeless encampment with 80 tents has sprung up by San Francisco's City Hall, part of an effort to protect the homeless amid the coronavirus pandemic.
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: DHOL received multiple calls and a message from Wedlocks Bridal...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

DHOL received multiple calls and a message from Wedlocks Bridal Hair and Makeup on 21st st. There is a small camp outside of their office and wanted some assistance with some issues they were having. I went to the camp. I know the residents there well. Very well. I spoke with them, then went into Wedlocks to speak to the owner. Michelle who goes by "Nine" was relieved to see me after reaching out for help. We talked a bit. She was told by DPD not to engage with the camp resid...ents, advice she followed which she now regrets. She felt like things had gotten out of hand and she didn't know how to real it back in. I asked her how I could help. She wanted to find common ground and have some agreements around coexisting. I offered to facilitate a conversation with her and the camp residents. We went outside and had a chat. They got to know a little bit about one another and then hashed out some agreements. They agreed to work together for their mutual survival (residents and business together). When I left they were all sitting on the sidewalk in a circle talking and laughing. Another way is possible and we can all be part of the solution. Choice is yours.

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud
